fs.polyglot.validate
Class TabooValidator

java.lang.Object
  fs.validate.AbstractComponentValidator<T>
      fs.validate.LabelIndicValidator<javax.swing.text.JTextComponent>
          fs.polyglot.validate.TabooValidator
All Implemented Interfaces:
ComponentValidator<javax.swing.text.JTextComponent>, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener
public class TabooValidator
extends LabelIndicValidator<javax.swing.text.JTextComponent>

This validator makes sure, a text fields content is not in a given list of strings (this might be used to ensure uniqueness of ID's, etc...). It's also possible to ensure that the content is not empty (after trimming)

Author:
Simon Hampe

Constructor Summary
TabooValidator(javax.swing.ImageIcon correct, javax.swing.ImageIcon warning, javax.swing.ImageIcon incorrect, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> tabooList, boolean canBeEmpty)
          Constructs a LabelIndicValidator, which regards a JTextField's content as correct, if it is not empty and not in the tabooList, and otherwise as incorrect.
 
Method Summary
 void setCanBeEmpty(boolean canBeEmpty)
          Sets whether the empty string is allowed as content and notifies all change listeners if the new value is different.
 void setTabooList(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> tabooList)
          This sets the list of incorrect values and notifies all change listeners.
 ValidationResult.Result validate(javax.swing.text.JTextComponent component)
          Returns CORRECT, if the TextFields content is not in the taboo list (after trimming of whitespaces) and, if canBeEmpty has been set to false, if it isn't empty (after trimming).

Constructor Detail

TabooValidator

public TabooValidator(javax.swing.ImageIcon correct,
                      javax.swing.ImageIcon warning,
                      javax.swing.ImageIcon incorrect,
                      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> tabooList,
                      boolean canBeEmpty)
Constructs a LabelIndicValidator, which regards a JTextField's content as correct, if it is not empty and not in the tabooList, and otherwise as incorrect.

Parameters:
correct - The Icon for the associated label, if the content is correct
warning - never used
incorrect - The icon for the associated label, if the content is incorrect
tabooList - A list of strings which are not valid content
Indicates - whether an empty text field should be regared as correct or not
Method Detail

setTabooList

public void setTabooList(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> tabooList)
This sets the list of incorrect values and notifies all change listeners. If it is null, it is interpreted as the empty list.

setCanBeEmpty

public void setCanBeEmpty(boolean canBeEmpty)
Sets whether the empty string is allowed as content and notifies all change listeners if the new value is different.

validate

public ValidationResult.Result validate(javax.swing.text.JTextComponent component)
Returns CORRECT, if the TextFields content is not in the taboo list (after trimming of whitespaces) and, if canBeEmpty has been set to false, if it isn't empty (after trimming). Otherwise returns INCORRECT. Returns INCORRECT for a null component

Specified by:
validate in class AbstractComponentValidator<javax.swing.text.JTextComponent>
